definition: pavilion with a view/high/tall/high fronted, curtained carriage (old)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]

sentences.english: The argumentation on"holiday economic"had aroused a violent disturbance in China.
sentences.chinese: 關於“假日經濟”的大討論在中國引起了軒然大波。

sentences.english: A new book out in France has a literary world buzzing.
sentences.chinese: 在法國，一本新書在文學界引起了軒然大波。

sentences.english: The landslide occurred in the village caused a stir at home and abroad.
sentences.chinese: 青寧鄉巖門村滑坡的發生在國內外引起了軒然大波。

sentences.english: His sudden death shocked not only those in the film  circles.
sentences.chinese: 謝導的死訊在影視圈內外都引起了軒然大波。

sentences.english: His sudden death shocked not only those in the film circles.
sentences.chinese: 謝導的死訊在影視圈內外都引起了軒然大波。

sentences.english: No one would expect a trivial thing could cause such a great disturbance.
sentences.chinese: 沒料到芝麻大的事兒竟會引起這樣一場軒然大波。

sentences.english: Just be the check caught, to provoke up a storm.
sentences.chinese: 正好被阿帕查撞見，惹起一場軒然大波。

sentences.english: Who could have thought a trivial matter would cause such a stir?
sentences.chinese: 沒料到芝麻大的事兒竟會引起這樣一場軒然大波。

sentences.english: I never thought this matter as gingeli will arouse such a great disturbance.
sentences.chinese: 沒料到芝麻大的事兒竟會引起這樣一場軒然大波。

definition: variant of 轟動|轰动[hong1 dong4]
(coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with

(neologism c. 2013) organized disruption of healthcare facilities or verbal and physical abuse of medical staff, by an aggrieved patient or proxies such as family members or hired thugs, typically aimed at obtaining compensation
lit. wind sighing and crane calling (idiom)/fig. to panic at the slightest move/to be jittery
hissing sound/to hiss (as a sign of displeasure)
